heroParagraph: Forta produces custom CNC parts and engineering plastic components. With over 30 years of experience, we manage the full process from design to production, providing solutions for your CNC and plastic projects.
plasticDescription: We supply plastic components crafted from industrial-grade materials. Our plastics offer excellent mechanical, thermal, and chemical properties, making them ideal for demanding environments across multiple industries.
cncDescription: We offer high-precision CNC machining services tailored to meet the needs of demanding industrial applications. Whether you require single prototypes or full production runs, our expertise ensures reliable, accurate, and repeatable parts every time.
cncList: Services: CNC Turning ; CNC Milling ; 5-Axis Machining ; Laser Cutting ...
aboutTitle: We build your solutions, piece by piece.
aboutDescription: With over 30 years of experience, Forta. designs and manufactures high-quality custom mechanical parts. We specialize in CNC machining with a focus on the production of engineering plastic components, serving industries such as food, chemical, automotive, and automation. From design to maintenance, we deliver complete technical solutions with precision and reliability.
industryFoodDesc: We supply food-grade plastic and precision CNC parts for hygienic and durable use in food processing and bottling lines.
industryPharmaDesc: Our corrosion-resistant components are ideal for use in chemical tanks, lab equipment, and pharmaceutical packaging systems.
industryAutomationDesc: We produce timing screws, guides, and CNC components that keep automated filling and packaging lines running smoothly and efficiently.
industryFiltDesc: We manufacture plastic and metal components for solid-liquid separation equipment, including filter presses.
industryEnergyDesc: Our engineering plastics are built to withstand extreme conditions in power systems, industrial utilities, and clean energy installations.
industryMachineryDesc: We engineer and machine parts that ensure operational stability and durability in complex industrial equipment and production systems.
about_us_heroDescription: Your trusted partner in plastic & CNC engineering for over three decades
about_us_paragraph_1: With over 30 years in CNC machining, design, and production, is your partner for high-quality custom mechanical parts. We offer personalized service and specialized solutions for a wide range of industries, including food and beverage, chemical, paper, automotive, healthcare, energy, process automation, conveyor technology and others.
about_us_paragraph_2: We excel in the production of parts made from engineering plastics (PP, HDPE, POM, PA, PTFE, etc.). Our dedication to technological progress ensures we continually enhance our capabilities to deliver complex machine components.
our_mission_paragraph: At Forta, our mission is simple. We deliver reliable, high-precision mechanical parts and plastic components that empower our clients' performance. We combine decades of expertise with continuous innovation to provide custom solutions that meet the highest industrial standards, from design to delivery.
about_quote_text: We empower industrial performance through precision, innovation, and reliability.
valor_description1: We strive for perfection in every project, guaranteeing the highest quality for our customers.
valor_description2: We constantly invest in new technologies to remain at the forefront.
valor_description3: We build lasting relationships based on trust and collaboration.
legal_notice_intellectual_property_text: All content on this website, including texts, images, graphics, logos, and design elements, is the intellectual property of Forta. or its partners, and may not be copied, modified, or reused without written permission.
legal_notice_limitation_of_liability_tex: Forta. strives to keep all website content accurate and up to date, but cannot be held liable for any errors, omissions, or consequences arising from the use of this website.
legal_notice_contact_inquiry_text: For any questions regarding this legal notice or website usage, you can contact us at:
conf_policy_data_intro: We place great importance on protecting your personal data.
conf_policy_data_collection: Data collected via the contact form (name, email address, message) is used solely to respond to your inquiries.
conf_policy_data_use: Your information is never shared with third parties and is kept only as long as necessary to process your request.
conf_policy_data_security: We implement appropriate security measures to protect your personal data.
conf_policy_cookies_intro: This site does not use advertising or tracking cookies.
conf_policy_cookies_types: Only technical services such as Google Fonts may collect technical information (e.g., IP address).
conf_policy_hypertext_link_text: This site may contain links to other websites for which we are not responsible regarding content and privacy policies.
conf_policy_contact_text: For any questions regarding your personal data, you can contact us:

hero_section.paragraph: Turn your industrial challenges into success with our plastic engineering solutions. Over 30 years of innovation dedicated to technical precision.

materials_section.title: Advanced Technologies
materials_section.description: A carefully selected range of high-performance materials designed to meet the most demanding challenges

PP.name: Polypropylene (PP)
PP.description: Versatile material with excellent chemical resistance and mechanical properties
PP.fullDescription: Polypropylene (PP), whose chemical formula is a semi-crystalline thermoplastic polymer known for its exceptional strength-to-weight ratio. It is one of the lightest plastics on the market. Its structure gives it high resistance to flexural fatigue, making it a preferred choice for integral hinge applications. With excellent chemical inertness, PP is highly resistant to organic solvents, acids and alkalis, which is crucial for its use in chemical packaging and laboratory equipment. Its melting point range, between 160°C and 170°C, allows for heat sterilisation and safe use in microwaves. These properties, combined with its ease of processing by injection moulding or extrusion, position polypropylene as an essential material in the automotive, household appliance, medical and packaging industries.

PE.name: PE 300/500/1000
PE.description: Ultra high-performance range for critical applications
PE.fullDescription: High-density polyethylene (HDPE) is a semi-crystalline thermoplastic polymer that is highly prized in plastics engineering for its ease of machining and excellent value for money. It is known for its high impact resistance and rigidity, with a relatively high density. In the CNC and processing industry, technical grades are classified according to their molecular weight, which directly influences their performance. PE 300 is a versatile standard grade, ideal for non-critical components. PE 500, with its increased molecular weight, offers better abrasion resistance and superior durability for parts subject to moderate wear. Finally, PE 1000, or Ultra-High Molecular Weight Polyethylene (UHMW-PE), represents the pinnacle of this family of polymers. Its exceptionally high molecular weight gives it unrivalled wear resistance, a very low coefficient of friction and excellent shock absorption, making it the material of choice for sliding applications, protective coatings and heavily stressed mechanical parts.

PA6.name: Polyamide 6 (PA6)
PA6.description: Excellent mechanical strength and abrasion resistance
PA6.fullDescription: Polyamide 6 (PA6) is a semi-crystalline thermoplastic polymer widely recognised in plastics engineering for its excellent balance of strength, hardness and toughness. It is distinguished by its high resistance to wear and abrasion, low coefficient of friction and ability to absorb shocks, making it a material of choice for dynamic mechanical applications. In the CNC industry, PA6 is particularly valued for its good machinability, allowing the production of complex parts with a high-quality finish. Its thermal and chemical resistance also makes it suitable for demanding environments. These properties, combined with its rigidity, position it as a high-performance substitute for metals in many applications, such as gears, bushings, rollers and machine parts subject to high stresses.

POMC.name: POM-C (Acetal)
POMC.fullDescription: POM-C (Acetal) is a semi-crystalline thermoplastic polymer renowned for its high rigidity, hardness and excellent dimensional stability, particularly in humid environments. In engineering and CNC machining, it is particularly valued for its exceptional machinability, which allows complex, high-precision parts to be produced with a remarkable surface finish. Thanks to its low coefficient of friction and good wear resistance, POM-C is an ideal material for mechanical components such as gears, bushings, rollers and sleeves, where it can often replace metals. Its creep resistance also makes it reliable for parts subject to long-term stress.

PTFE.name: PTFE (Teflon)
PTFE.description: Unmatched non-stick properties and thermal resistance
PTFE.fullDescription: PTFE (polytetrafluoroethylene), commonly known as Teflon, is a unique semi-crystalline thermoplastic polymer that is widely used in plastic engineering due to its extremely low coefficient of friction. It has remarkable chemical resistance, making it virtually inert to almost all corrosive products. PTFE also offers excellent thermal resistance, maintaining its properties over a wide range of temperatures. In CNC machining, although it is a soft material, it is valued for the manufacture of high-precision parts. Its unique properties make it an ideal choice for critical applications such as seals, non-stick coatings and components subject to high friction loads.
